name: Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales
goal:
ICAEW operates under a Royal Charter, working in the public interest. Its regulation of its members, in particular its responsibilities in respect of auditors, is overseen by the UK Financial Reporting Council. As a world leading professional accountancy body, ICAEW provides leadership and practical support to over 147,000 members around the world, working with governments, regulators and industry to ensure the highest standards are maintained.
Our members provide financial knowledge and guidance based on the highest technical and ethical standards. We develop and support individuals, organisations and communities to help them achieve long-term, sustainable economic value.
interests: Budget, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Enterprise, General and Institutional Affairs, Internal Market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives:
• Financial reporting & accounting, including IFRS endorsement
• Capital Markets Union (COM(2015)468), particularly related to forthcoming mid-term review and insolvency matters (COM(2016)723)
• Tax policy, including the proposal to amend Directive 2013(34)EU (CBCR), work on CCCTB (COM(2016)685)) + plus issues relating to PANA committee and role of tax advisors
• Public sector finances, including measures relating to public sector accounting standards (IPSAS/EPSAS) (COM(2013)114)
• Audit policy, including implementation of Audit Regulation (537/2014) and Audit Directive (2014/56/EU)
• Single Market issues, including actions from the Commission Single Market Strategy COM(2015)550

As well as developments in the financial services / corporate governance / company law / digital policy / sustainability / enterprise / professional requirements & skills areas
